intro: Taetsia stricta, commonly known as the slender taetsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Taetsia stricta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
